        public static boolean isValidLocation(android.location.Location location)
        Method for validating an location's latitude and longitude
        Parameters:
        location - A location to check
        Returns:
        true, if location.lat != 0.0 and location.lng != 0.0

      • toJSON

        public org.json.JSONObject toJSON()
        Returns a JSONObject, with mapped values for, what is needed for an API request:
        • Latitude
        • Longitude
        • Sensor
        • Radius
        Returns:
        The mapped JSONObject

      • set

        public void set(android.location.Location l)
        Sets the contents of the location to the values from the given location.

        The sensor value is explicitly set to true when setting location via this method (as it's likely from a sensor e.g. gps or network

        Overrides:
        set in class android.location.Location

      • set

        public void set(SgnLocation l)

      • getRadius

        public int getRadius()
        Get current radius
        Returns:
        radius in meters.

      • setRadius

        public void setRadius(int radius)
        Set radius for this location.

        Minimum radius is 0, and maximum radius is 700000

        Parameters:
        radius - A radius distance in meters
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if radius is out of bounds

      • setLatitude

      • isSensor

        public boolean isSensor()
        Determines if the location is set by a sensor
        Returns:
        true if location have been set by a sensor

      • setSensor

        public void setSensor(boolean sensor)
        Set whether the location has been set by sensor.
        Sensor is automatically set to true if location is set via setLocation(Location l) and the given location is from a sensor (network, or GPS).
        Parameters:
        sensor - true if it's a device sensor, else false

      • getAddress

        public java.lang.String getAddress()
        Returns an address, of this location if the address have previously been set with setAddress(String).
        Returns:
        an address if one was given, else null

      • setAddress

        public void setAddress(java.lang.String address)
        Set a new address on the location
        Parameters:
        address - An address

      • isSet

        public boolean isSet()
        Method for determining if the location have indeed been set.
        Returns:
        true, if latitude != 0.0 and longitude != 0.0

      • isBoundsSet

        public boolean isBoundsSet()

      • distanceTo

        public int distanceTo(Store store)
        Returns the approximate distance in meters between this location and the given location. Distance is defined using the WGS84 ellipsoid.
        Parameters:
        store - to measure distance to
        Returns:
        the approximate distance in meters
        See Also:
        Location.distanceTo(Location)

      • setBounds

        public void setBounds(double boundNorth,
                      double boundEast,
                      double boundSouth,
                      double boundWest)
        Set the bounds for queries All parameters should be GPS coordinates.
        Parameters:
        boundNorth - A northern boundary
        boundEast - A eastern boundary
        boundSouth - A southern boundary
        boundWest - A western boundary

      • isSame

        public boolean isSame(SgnLocation other)
        Checks if two SgnLocation is at the same point in the eyes of the API. So, latitude, longitude, radius and sensor will be checked. (and null)

        It's not an equals method

        Parameters:
        other - A location to compare with
        Returns:
        true if they are the same, otherwise false
